p: Plant description: Withania somnifera ( W. somnifera) is a small woody shrub belonging to the family Solanaceae and is widely grown in India. It is commonly called Indian ginseng or winter cherry or ashwagandha. Its flowers are greenish or yellowish in color and about one centimeter long [ 147, 148]. Ashwagandha is mentioned in ancient Sanskrit writings from India as a “Medhya rasayan”. It is also known as Indian ginseng and is widely used in Ayurveda. It is an ingredient in many formulations prescribed as a general tonic to increase energy, improve overall health and longevity [ 147, 148].
